intro: Boehmeria sanguinea var. minor, commonly known as red-flowered nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Urticaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
